articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Greets FM of Poland
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Greets FM of Poland
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Tuesday sent a message of greetings to his Polish counterpart Radoslaw Sikorski on the occasion of the Constitutional Day, national day of Poland.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop in various fields, the message wished the Polish foreign minister greater success in his work.

articles.title: Polish Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception
articles.content:
Polish Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Polish Ambassador to the DPRK Edward Pietrzyk gave a reception Tuesday to mark the Constitutional Day, the national holiday of Poland.
					 Preset there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture, Ki Kwang Ho, vice-minister of Finance, Mun Jae Chol, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Staff members of the Polish embassy were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Talks Held between Chiefs of DPRK-German Parliamentary Groups
articles.content:
Talks Held between Chiefs of DPRK and German Parliamentary Groups 
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Talks were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday between Ri Jong Hyok, chairman of the DPRK-German Parliamentary Friendship Group, and Stefan Muller, chairman of the German-Korean Parliamentary Friendship Group.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were officials concerned and from the opposite side the German ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the matter of further developing the relations between the two groups and issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: DPRK Red Cross Society Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Red Cross Society Delegation Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society headed by Paek Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the C.C., the Red Cross Society of the DPRK, left here on Tuesday by air to visit China.

articles.title: German President on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
German President on Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The development of the relations between Germany and the DPRK is in full line with the wellbeing of the two peoples. I wish the Korean people many successes in their efforts to improve the standard of people's living and building a thriving nation. German President Christian Wulff said this when meeting with DPRK Ambassador to his country Hong Chang Il on April 29 who paid a farewell call on him.
					 The bilateral relations between the two countries have maintained the trend of steady development since the establishment of diplomatic relations, the president said, referring to the exchange in cultural and sports fields.
					
					 The stability on the Korean Peninsula is very important for global peace, he said, hoping that military conflicts would be checked by the joint efforts of the north and the south and all the issues be settled in a peaceful way through dialogue and negotiations.

articles.title: Symposium on Architectural Aesthetics Held
articles.content:
Symposium on Architectural Aesthetics Held
						
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The 6th Symposium on Architectural Aesthetics took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday.
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Jon Ha Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials concerned, officials in the fields of architecture, building and building materials, designers, technicians, teachers, researchers and creators in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 The symposium was held on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Theory of Architectural Art". Speakers at the symposium explained and proved in depth the scientific accuracy and vitality of the ideas and theories expounded in the work and the issues arising in building monumental edifices in the era of Songun true to the idea of the WPK on architecture.
					
					 They said that the work comprehensively analyzes and reviews the achievements and experience gained in the architectural field of the country and the human history of architecture and gives perfect answers to all the theoretical and practical problems arising in practice.
					
					 They stressed that many monumental edifices glorifying the era have sprung up in different parts of the country and cities and villages have turned into a socialist land of bliss thanks to the drive to apply the Juche-based ideas and theories on architecture over the past two decades, ushering in a great heyday of Juche-based architecture.
					
					 They noted that the essence and contents of architecture have been clarified scientifically thanks to the original ideas and theories on architecture and society enunciated in the work.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung 
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The participants of the 13th Pyongyang symposium of Koreans at home and abroad on medical science laid a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill on Tuesday.
					 They placed a floral basket and bouquets before the statue of the President, expressing boundless reverence for him who indicated the road to be followed by the Juche-oriented medical science.
					
					 They paid tribute to him.
					
					 The home-visiting group of Koreans in Japan led by Kim Yong Jun, chairman of the Higashiyodogawa Branch of Osaka Prefecture of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, also visited the statue of the President on the same day to pay tribute to him.

articles.title: National Exhibition of Software for Sports Held
articles.content:
National Exhibition of Software for Sports Held
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition of software for sports took place here from April 26 to May 3. 
					 On display in the venue of the exhibition were more than 130 programs including the programs for training control and supporting  the analysis of matches, educational multi-media program and business program for the management of organs developed recently by the Academy of Sports Science, the sports team of the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport, Korea University of Physical Education and other units. 
					
					 Highly appreciated by the visitors were the real-time shooting control system, weightlifting training control and game analysis and supporting system, the system for the selection of reserve players and measurement of their qualities, system for the analysis of ability of physical bodies, multi-media for education in football and support program and many other programs. 
					
					 A closing ceremony of the exhibition was held at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Tuesday.

articles.title: Exhibition of Metal Relics Goes on
articles.content:
Exhibition of Metal Relics Goes on
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of metal relics is going on at the Korean Central History Museum.
					 On show at the museum are more than 120 pieces of metal relics belonging to the periods from Ancient Korea to the Ri Dynasty (1392-1910). They are weapons, Buddhist images, decorations and personal ornaments.
					
					 The weapons include lute-shaped dagger, sword, arrow and arrowhead.
					
					 In particular, an arrow with a fire wick made in the period of Koryo kingdom (918-1392) and cannon made in the period of the Ri Dynasty attract visitors' interest.
					
					 The Buddhist images date back to the periods of Koguryo (277 B.C.-668), Paekje (late 1st century B.C.-660), Silla, Koryo and Ri Dynasty.
					
					 Among the decorations and personal ornaments are bronze censer, gold earring, dragon-patterned bronze mirror and silver-decorated knife.
					
					 Metal type with a long history in Korea is also displayed.
					
					 A model of cavalcade discovered in Kosan County, Kangwon Province, consists of 54 iron horses and 4 bronze horses.
					
					 The exhibition continues till the end of May.

articles.title: Months of Herb Cultivation in Korea
articles.content:
Months of Herb Cultivation in Korea
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- April and May are months of medicinal herb cultivation in Korea. 
					 Herb farms in South and North Phyongan Provinces have finished sowing of several dozen species of medical plants and tended seedbeds for planting herb seedlings in early May.
					
					 Chongjin, Kim Chaek, Yonsa, Kyongwon and other cities and counties of North Hamgyong Province have planted herbs on mountains covering hundreds of hectares.
					
					 Herb seedlings are also provided in the way of tissue culture. 
					
					 Tissue culture facilities have been built in herb farms throughout the country.
					
					 Mangyongdae Herb Management Station, Sangwon Herb Farm and Chollima Koryo Medicine Factory have cultivated many species of herbs, including salvia mileriorrhiza, in the way of tissue culture.

articles.title: Ryongsong Machine Complex
articles.content:
Ryongsong Machine Complex
						
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The Ryongsong Machine Complex, a major machine producer of the DPRK, has made geothermal equipment, including high-capacity screw compressor, condenser, evaporator and submersible pump.
					 The complex has contributed to the development of the country's self-supporting national economy with the production of various machines.
					
					 In the first five-year plan (1957-1961), its workers made 1 125 kW speed reducer and 8-m turning lathe.
					
					 In the 1960s, they produced a 3,000 ton press, a 6,000 ton press and other ordered equipment.
					
					 They manufactured 20-m lathe, 18-m turning lathe, 400-mm planer and 5,000-m drilling machine in the 1970s.
					
					 They made a 3,000 kW high-pressure gas compressor, 70-m double-housing planer, 10,000 ton press and other equipment in the 1980s and the 1990s.
					
					 Last year, streamlined iron foundry and compressor workshop started operation in the complex. 
					
					 This year, the complex manufactured equipment and compressors necessary for the gasification project of the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex.
					
					 The complex has several factories and branch factories.

articles.title: Worker Saved from Jaws of Death
articles.content:
Worker Saved from Jaws of Death
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, a worker of the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex who had been in a critical condition after getting a burn on 75 percent of his body recovered his health and returned to his job.
					 When Pak Pong Phil was taken to a hospital attached to the complex, in a state of coma, in last September, nobody thought it would be possible to bring him back to life.
					
					 Urgent consultations were held several times to take steps for his treatment. Necrosed parts were removed from his body and skin transplantations conducted successfully over ten times.
					
					 More than sixty doctors and nurseries donated their blood and skin.
					
					 Competent medical scientists of Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University and doctors of the North Hwanghae Provincial People's Hospital rendered assistance to the treatment.
					
					 Koryo medicines and finger-pressure therapy suitable for the patient's physical condition were also applied to the treatment.
					
					 Leaving the hospital, Pak expressed his heartfelt thanks to the Workers' Party of Korea, which established a popular health system in the country.

articles.title: "Freedom of Thought" Touted by Imperialists Dismissed as Hypocritical
articles.content:
"Freedom of Thought" Touted by Imperialists Dismissed as Hypocritical 
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The "freedom of thought" touted by the imperialists is a hypocritical slogan aimed to suppress the progressive idea in the capitalist societies and justify all their means and methods to spread bourgeois reactionary ideas and the ideological and cultural poisoning of other countries.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					The imperialists-touted "freedom of thought" is aimed to suppress the progressive ideas and spread bourgeois reactionary thoughts.
					
					The reactionary bourgeois ruling class pretends to allow to a certain extent the progressive ideas in a bid to embellish the capitalist society as "a sample of freedom" and "democratic society" but mercilessly suppresses them when it considers they are threatening its rule even a bit.
					
					 The suppression of the progressive thoughts still persists in the capitalist countries.
					
					 The imperialists are becoming evermore undisguised in their ideological and cultural poisoning of the socialist countries and independent countries against imperialism.
					
					 The imperialists are openly vociferating that those countries they cannot bring them to their knees with nuclear weapons can easily be brought down by the spread of bourgeois ideology and culture.
					
					They are running the whole gamut of means and methods to spread bourgeois ideas and culture. They include newspapers, magazines and broadcasting services and other propaganda media, diplomacy under the veil of "cooperation" and "exchange" and even advertisement.
					
					The serious consequences entailed by the acceptance of the above-said "freedom of thought" is eloquently proved by the tragic reality of those countries where socialism collapsed.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Observed 
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Leading papers Tuesday dedicate bylined articles to the anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's clarification of the three principles of national reunification-- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity.
					 Kim Il Sung clarified the main principles of national reunification as the three principles when meeting the delegate of south Korea who came to Pyongyang to participate in the first round of the north-south high-ranking political talks on May 3, 1972.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun in an article says that the three principles became a reunification programme common to the nation as the north and the south issued the July 4 joint statement, affirming the above-said principles as the main principles for the solution to the issue of reunification and solemnly declaring them.  The three principles are the cornerstone of national reunification as they clarified the fundamental stand and ways for solving the issue of national reunification by the Koreans themselves, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The issue of national reunification, an internal affair of the nation, can be solved only by the strength and efforts of the Koreans.
					
					 In order to solve the issue of reunification by peaceful means in line with the wishes and interests of the nation, it is necessary to put a definite end to the foreign forces' moves for aggression and war. 
					
					 The Korean nation can establish sovereignty throughout Korea and achieve peace and peaceful reunification only when the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces, the root cause of war, are driven out of south Korea.
					
					 The great unity of the nation alone can show a way out for the nation and guarantee its dignity and reunification and prosperity. 
					
					 Minju Joson says that the Korean people will surely build a prosperous reunified country on the land of Korea by holding fast to the three principles hand in hand with all other fellow countrymen and dynamically waging a more organized and mass struggle for the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration true to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Halt to Arms Buildup Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Halt to Arms Buildup Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held the 111th  rally for peace and disarmament outside the puppet Defense Affairs Agency on April 29 demanding the puppet authorities stop the arms buildup aimed to ignite a war.
					 The agency clarified it would push forward the work to procure large attack helicopters in a report submitted to the "Defense Committee of the National Assembly" on April 13, the organization noted, adding that this was part of the present "government's" moves to carry out the strategy for mounting a preemptive attack on the north.
					
					 It demanded an immediate halt to the arms buildup as it diametrically runs counter to the wishes of the whole nation and international public for the improved inter-Korean relations and peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The organization stressed that it would intensify the actions for checking the moves for procuring the above-said helicopters with the taxes collected from the people and achieve peace.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Stage Anti-"government" Actions
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Stage Anti-"government" Actions
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A huge rally for judging the traitorous regime was held in Seoul on Sunday, May Day, with more than 20,000 members of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions attending.
					 Speakers at the rally accused the present "government" of pursuing an extremely pro-tycoon policy, bringing profits to the privileged circles and ruthlessly bleeding the workers white.
					
					 The recent by-election showed once again the people's resentment at the present regime, they said, calling for judging the traitorous regime through the unity of the progressive forces and building a society in which workers are respected.
					
					 At the end of the rally its participants staged a demo.
					
					 The south Korean Federation of Trade Unions also held a rally in Seoul to shatter the suppression of the labor movement and demand a total revision of the Law on Trade Unions.
					
					 Meanwhile, the two organizations issued a joint declaration on the situation denouncing the authorities' misrule.
					
					 They warned that the present regime will face strong anti-"government" actions of workers unless they make an apology to the people for having driven the people's livelihood into destitution through its pro-tycoon policy. 
					
					 At least 600 members of the KCTU held a rally at the plaza of Seoul Railway Station on April 30 demanding a wage hike and abolition of part-time job.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers' Rally for Reunification Held
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers' Rally for Reunification Held
						
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A workers rally for reunification took place in Seoul on Sunday under the sponsorship of the Labor Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration.
					 Attending there were representatives of civic and public organizations and political parties including the Confederation of Trade Unions, the Federation of Trade Unions, the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification and the Democratic Labor Party.
					
					 Speakers at the rally noted with resentment that the rally the workers' organizations in the south and the north planned to jointly hold on May Day could not take place owing to the desperate efforts of the authorities and they were compelled to hold rallies separately.     They warned that history will certainly judge the present authorities for ruthlessly dampening the desire of the workers for independent reunification.
					
					 They called upon all the workers to make louder the sound of hammering for independence, peace and reunification with the stronger will to open a new phase without fail in bringing the present grave situation under control.
					
					 They declared that they would wage a more dynamic struggle to thoroughly preserve and implement the south-north joint declarations and achieve contact, cooperation and solidarity with the north.

articles.title: S. Korea Affected by Sandy Dust
articles.content:
S. Korea Affected by Sandy Dust
						
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Most serious sandy dust this year was observed in all parts of south Korea on Sunday, according to the south Korean CBS.
					Its concentration level was 388μg per a cubic meter in Jin Islet of South Jolla Province and that was 184μg in Seoul.
					
					 The sandy dust has become worse from the afternoon of that day.

articles.title: Peerlessly Great Persons' Feats in Army Building Praised
articles.content:
Peerlessly Great Persons' Feats in Army Building Praised
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A regional body and Swiss organizations posted on their Internet homepages articles on April 23 and 25 on the occasion of the army day of the DPRK.
					The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions posted on its Internet homepage the following article titled "The Korean People's Army" accompanied by photos on revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il:
					
					 The President founded the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army on April 25, 1932.
					
					The army was reorganized into the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and developed into the Korean People's Army, the regular armed forces in 1948.
					
					 The President made long journeys of bloody battles against the one million strong forces of the Japanese imperialists for 15 years, accomplishing the historic cause of national liberation. He defeated the U.S. imperialists who boasted of their "mightiness" in the 1950s, honorably defending the dignity and sovereignty of the country.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, a creditable successor to the cause of the President, strengthened the ideological education in the KPA, training all its service persons as fighters strong in idea and faith.
					
					 The KPA commanded by Kim Jong Il is winning victories only, demonstrating its might as an invincible army.
					
					 The Swiss-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on their Internet homepages articles praising Kim Jong Il for glorifying the DPRK as a political and ideological power and a military power by carrying forward and developing the Songun idea of the President.

articles.title: DPRK Army Day Celebrated by Russian and Pakistani Papers
articles.content:
DPRK Army Day Celebrated by Russian and Pakistani Papers
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Russian and Pakistani papers carried special write-ups containing a commemorative article on the occasion of the 79th founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					The issue No. 16 of the Russian paper Patriot carried a special write-up interwoven with a portrait of President Kim Il Sung and photos on General Secretary Kim Jong Il's revolutionary activities.
					
					 The paper in an article gave a detailed account of the facts that thanks to the President's brilliant military idea and strategy and wise leadership, the KPA worked such miracles of history as defeating the U.S. and Japanese imperialists and has grown stronger to be invincible revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 The paper noted that Kim Jong Il has enforced the Songun politics, upholding the idea and cause of the President. But for the strong army, the DPRK could not have protected socialism from the ceaseless provocations of the U.S., it said.
					
					 The April 22nd issue of Pakistani papers Daily Assas and Al Akhbar carried articles titled "Extraordinary strategist" and "Korean People's Army, pillar of socialist cause." 
					
					 The papers praised the personality of Kim Jong Il as great man who is perfectly possessed of qualifications and traits as the peerlessly brilliant commander and the invincible might of the KPA.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Russia
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let's Give Fuller Play to the Advantages of Our People's Power" was published in booklet by the Khabarovsk Territory Publishing House of Russia on April 26.
					 The work, published on December 21, Juche 81 (1992), refers to the solidity and vitality of the people's power and clarifies the issues of enhancing its function and role, firmly adhering to the fundamental principle of building it and improving and strengthening the work of the people's power organs.

articles.title: High Radioactive Substance Still Leaks from Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant
articles.content:
High Radioactive Substance Still Leaks from Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The radiation caused by the accident at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan still remains serious.
					 The Japanese newspaper Tokyo Shimbun on April 27 carried the distribution chart which was opened to the public by the combined accident measure headquarters of the government and the Tokyo Electric Power Co. for the first time.
					
					 The distribution chart worked out on the basis of the amount of radiation measured in the area near the power plant confirmed that the amount of radiation in the area more than 30 km away from the power plant is 20 microsieverts per hour or hundreds of times that at an ordinary time.
					
					 The amount of radiation was higher in the areas northwest of the power plant.
					
					Radioactive iodine-131 of 56 Bq per 1 cc equal to 1,400 times the legal level was detected in sea water near the intake of Reactor No. 2 of the power plant.
					
					 Radioactive substance of comparatively high concentration was discovered in the sewage treatment facility of Gooriyama City, Fukushima Prefecture.
					
					Radioactive cesium of 26,400 Bq per kg was detected in mud of this facility and 334,000 Bq per kg in the roasted and cooled mud, NHK reported.
					
					It is reported that radioactive cesium detected in the roasted mud is nearly 1,300 times that handled before the accident in the power plant.
					
					 The Fukushima prefectural authorities assume that radioactive substance on the surface of the earth was washed away into the drainage set-up by rainwater and was accumulated in the course of sewage treatment.
					
					 At a time when the prospect for tiding over radioactive crisis remains gloomy, radioactive cesium going beyond the legal level was detected again in the fish caught in the waters off Kitaibaraki City, Ibaraki Prefecture adjacent to Fukushima Prefecture, Tokyo Shimbun said.
					
					 The seabed position near the epicenter which caused the massive quake moved about 50 meters southeast and rose 7 meters, according to the seabed prospecting.

articles.title: Radiation at Normal Level in Far East Region of Russia
articles.content:
Radiation at Normal Level in Far East Region of Russia
 Moscow, May 1 (KCNA) -- Radiation did not go beyond the normal level in the Far East Region of Russia, according to the results of measurement released by the Information Department of the Far East Regional Centre of the Ministry of Extraordinary Situation of Russia on April 27. 
					 It was reported that the measurement of radiation has been under way day and night in this region since the accident at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan.

articles.title: Vietnam Celebrates 36th Anniversary of Liberation of South Vietnam
articles.content:
Vietnam Celebrates 36th Anniversary of Liberation of   South Vietnam
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A ceremony was held in Ho Chi Minh City of Vietnam on April 29 to celebrate the 36th anniversary of South Vietnam's liberation and reunification of the country. 
					 Vietnamese President Nguyen Minh Triet and many high- ranking officials attended the event.
					
					 The chairman of Ho Chi Minh City People's Committee, addressing the ceremony, said that the liberation of South Vietnam and the reunification of the whole country were a victory won by the Vietnamese people through the struggle waged under the leadership of the Communist Party of Vietnam and President Ho Chi Minh. 
					
					 History has turned pages over, but the values of the Vietnamese people's great resistance for national salvation will be maintained forever, he added.

articles.title: China Calls for Boosting Cooperation in Security Field
articles.content:
China Calls for Boosting Cooperation in Security Field
 Beijing, May 1 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, state councilor of China and minister of Public Security, called for strengthening the cooperation among the member states of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization in the security field. He said this, when addressing the 6th meeting of the secretaries-general of the Security Council of the member states of SCO held in Astana, Kazakhstan on April 29. 
					 Terrorism, separatism and extremism still pose a serious threat to the regional security and stability, he said, adding that it is a realistic demand of all sides for deepening the cooperation to deal blows at these three forces, drug trafficking and other criminal acts.
					
					 China is ready to make a greater contribution to defending regional and world peace and stability and prosperity by joining various sides in the efforts to maintain close cooperation and coordination and put spurs to the steady sound development of SCO, he emphasized.

articles.title: Belorussian President Accuses EU Attitude
articles.content:
Belorussian President Accuses EU Attitude
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Belorussian President Aleksandr Lukashenko in a recent press conference accused the EU of its approach toward the issue of eradicating the aftermath of the Chernobyl disaster.
					 Belarus suffered bigger damage than any other countries owing to the accident of the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant, he said, adding that his country will endure the misfortune by itself.
					
					  Noting that EU does not want to see the revival of Belarus, he said: "No one helps us. We will not ask it for help".

articles.title: Supreme Leader of Islamic Revolution of Iran Denounces Enemy's Plots
articles.content:
Supreme Leader of Islamic Revolution of Iran Denounces Enemy's Plots
 Tehran, May 1 (KCNA) -- Supreme Leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei, addressing a meeting on April 27, strongly denounced the enemy's plots.
					 The enemy has mostly focused their campaign against Islam and the Islamic Republic on the economy, while they are pushing ahead with their efforts in order to create a rift between the people and the (Islamic) establishment, he said.
					
					 They attempted to isolate Iran, but the result has been the opposite, he noted.
					
					 The country's laborers and officials should redouble their efforts to thwart the enemies' endeavors, which are targeting the country's economy, he added.

articles.title: Damage by Storms and Tornados Increases in US
articles.content:
Damage by Storms and Tornados Increases in US
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The damage caused by storms and tornados that hit the southeastern region of the U.S. is on the steady increase.
					 The death toll increased to 350 as of Sunday and a state of emergency was declared in 7 states.
					
					 The U.S. meteorological authorities predicted that strong storms and tornados are highly likely to occur in May, too.

articles.title: Origin of Storms and Tornados of US Identified
articles.content:
Origin of Storms and Tornados of US Identified
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The origin of storms and tornados that recently hit the southeastern region of the U.S. was identified.
					 The U.S. meteorological experts said that it was originated by La-Nina which continued for five months.
					
					 At least 900 storms and tornados were reported in the region in April.

articles.title: More Quakes Hit Indonesia
articles.content:
More Quakes Hit Indonesia
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A magnitude of 6 earthquake struck off waters off Sumatra Island, Indonesia on April 29.
					 A shallow earthquake with magnitude of 5.0 struck off Java Island of Indonesia earlier Friday.
					
					 The epicenter was 132 km southwest of Bantul of Jogjakarta Province.

articles.title: May Day Marked in China
articles.content:
May Day Marked in China
 Beijing, May 1 (KCNA) -- May Day was marked in China.
					 A ceremony of hoisting the national flag was held at Tiananmen in Beijing on Sunday with tens of thousands of people attending.
					
					 Sports and folk games were held in various cities on Sunday.
					
					 An evening gala on the theme of "Song of Labor" celebrating May Day was held at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on April 27.
					
					 On the occasion of May Day President Hu Jintao went round Tianjin City, congratulating working people on the day.

articles.title: May Day Marked in Russia
articles.content:
May Day Marked in Russia
 Moscow, May 1 (KCNA) -- May Day was marked in Russia on Sunday.
					 Meetings and demonstrations were held in Moscow on the initiatives of "United Russia" Party, "A Just Russia", the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the Liberal Democratic Party and other political parties and organizations.
					
					 About 25,000 people of broad strata participated in the demonstration organized by "United Russia" Party.
					
					 Demonstrations were also staged in Yekaterinburg, Yakutsk, Volgograd, Khabarovsk and other cities.

articles.title: Conversan presidentes de grupos de parlamentarios de Corea y Alemania
articles.content:
Conversan presidentes de grupos de parlamentarios de Corea y Alemania
Pyongyang, 3 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el día 3 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre el presidente del Grupo de Parlamentarios de Amistad Corea-Alemania, Ri Jong Hyok, y el titular del Grupo de Parlamentarios Alemania-Corea, Stefan Muller.
					Asistieron por la parte coreana los funcionarios correspondientes y por la alemana, el embajador acreditado en Corea. 
					
					Ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones entre sus entidades y otros problemas de interés mutuo.

articles.title: VI Simposio sobre la Estética Arquitectónica
articles.content:
VI Simposio sobre la Estética Arquitectónica
						
Pyongyang, 3 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el día 3 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el VI Simposio sobre la Estética Arquitectónica con motivo del 20º aniversario de la publicación de la obra del Dirigente Kim Jong Il "El arte arquitectónico".
					Asistieron el secretario del Comité Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, el viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, Jon Ha Chol, los funcionarios de las ramas de arquitectura, construcción y de materiales de construcción en el centro y localidades, los diseñadores, técnicos, maestros, investigadores y creadores de la rama. 
					
					En el certamen los oradores explicaron profundamente el carácter científico y la vitalidad de las ideas y teorías reflejadas en la obra y los problemas que se presentan en edificar las creaciones monumentales de la época del Songun, en acato a la ideología del PTC en materia de la arquitectura. 
					
					Dijeron que la obra analiza y balancea generalmente los éxitos y experiencias logrados en dicha rama y la historia de arquitectura de la humanidad y da las respuestas perfectas a todos los problemas teórico-prácticos que se presentan en la realidad. 
					
					A lo largo de estos 20 años se levantaron por doquier del país incontables creaciones monumentales en medio de la lucha por materializar las autóctonas ideas y teorías arquitectónicas y se acondicionaron las ciudades y aldeas como un paraíso socialista, subrayaron y agregaron que de esta manera se abrió una nueva era de prosperidad de la arquitectura al estilo coreano. 
					
					Gracias a las originales ideas y teorías sobre la arquitectura y la sociedad, dilucidadas por la obra, se han aclarado de modo científico la esencia y el contenido de la arquitectura, expresaron.

articles.title: Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong
articles.content:
Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong
						
Pyongyang, 3 de mayo (ATCC) -- Recientemente, el Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong de Corea fabricó el compresor enroscado de gran volumen, el condensador, el vaporizador, la bomba de oxígeno para buceo y otros equipos geotérmicos.
					Esta empresa diseñó y elaboró por cuenta propia los equipos sofisticados ahorradores de energía capaces de multiplicar la eficiencia de uso de energía térmica consumiendo menos electricidad que los anteriores equipos de calefacción y refrigeración.
					
					Es conocida como fábrica matriz porque tiene la capacidad de producir con sus fuerzas propias cualquier equipo sofisticado. 
					
					En el siglo pasado, los obreros de Ryongsong hicieron gran contribución al desarrollo de la economía nacional independiente usando su espíritu revolucionario de autoconfianza. 
					
					Durante el período del primer plan quinquenal, produjeron el molde de laminación de 510 mm y el desacelerador de 1125 kw y fabricaron dentro de 5 meses el torno vertical de 8 metros.
					
					En la década de 1960, produjeron los equipos necesarios en varias ramas de economía nacional como prensas de 3 mil y 6 mil toneladas. 
					
					Además, en la década de 1970, fabricaron el gran torno de 20 m, el torno vertical de 18 m, la acepilladora horizontal de 400 mm, la perforadora de 5,000 m, etc. y en la década de 1980, el compresor de gas de alta presión de 3,000 kw, la prensa de 10 mil toneladas, etc..
					
					En los años 90, lograron hacer los importantes equipos incluso el compresor de 3,000 kw.
					
					En el año pasado, acondicionaron la Fábrica de Hierro Fundido Songun y el taller de compresor Songun donde todos los procesos productivos están computerizados. 
					
					Este año, el complejo envió los equipos y compresores necesarios a la adsorción de gas y la síntesis de amonio que forman parte del proyecto de gasificación del Complejo de Abonos de Hungnam.
					
					El complejo tiene varias filiales.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun refuta la "libertad de ideas" defendida por imperialistas
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun refuta la "libertad de ideas" defendida por imperialistas
Pyongyang, 3 de mayo (ATCC) -- La "libertad de ideas", de que hablan tanto los imperialistas, es una consigna engañosa para justificar los medios y métodos, que se usan en la sociedad capitalista para suprimir las ideas progresistas y divulgar las reaccionarias de burguesía, y su campaña de penetración ideo-cultural contra otros países.
					Así señala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un artículo individual difundido este martes y continúa:
					
					A fin de describir el capitalismo como "ejemplo de libertad" y "sociedad democrática", la clase dominante reaccionaria y burguesa permite en un cierto tiempo las ideas progresistas, pero las suprime sin piedad cuando sientan que ellas amenazan a su sistema de dominación.
					
					En estos mismos instantes, en los países capitalistas continúa la represión contra los pensamientos progresistas.
					
					La campaña de penetración ideo-cultural de los imperialistas contra los países socialistas y los antiimperialistas e independientes se torna cada día más abiertamente.
					
					Ellos dicen sin escrúpulos que es posible derrumbar con la divulgación de idea y cultura burguesas a los países indoblegables ni con armas nucleares.
					
					Para ese fin, usan todos los medios y métodos como los periódicos, revistas, radios y otros medios de propaganda, la "cooperación" e "intercambio" y los anuncios mercantiles.
					
					La realidad trágica de los países del extinto campo socialista demuestra elocuentemente las nefastas consecuencias de la aceptación de la "libertad de idea".
